name: Castle Kamaole Sands

reviews.text: Value is not part of the vocabulary here, nor are the concepts of customer focus or asset reinvestment. To a large extent what you have here is a pool of misguided owners that think they have some proprietary right to gouge tenants while providing minimal standards. These fundamentals are fueled by a less than enthusiastic property manager that appears unwilling to establish quality standards for the units, continually audit to those standards and to remove deliquent owners from the rental pool.
reviews.title: Kamaole Scam

reviews.text: Now in fairness, I did see some upgraded units where Owner's appear to truly understand the relationship between quality, customer satisfaction and vacancy rates. Good for you and lucky for those tenants that were in these units! The problem is consistency - unfortunately there is none!

reviews.text: Having read thru a lot of these reviews before we set off, I have to admit we arrived at the complex feeling a little apprehensive with our adrenelin pumping, ready to do battle and get our yucky room swapped out. No way - are you kidding me?? We stayed in 10-107 and it was so delightful I don't care if there were better units (tho' I doubt it), we were so happy and with what we got. We even ditched our ideas to eat out, the grill areas were fabulous and thankfully everyone seemed to follow the rules to keep it clean for the next person, and we enjoyed ribs and steaks on our lanai each night instead, watching the sunset over the immaculate gardens and fountains and the ocean behind that. We were there for MaiTai Wednesday around the pool, and our 2 daughters (12 & 13) enjoyed the pool in general and especially the fussball.
reviews.title: Kamaole cook-outs

likes.liked: — It's incredible array of amenities - and the view.
likes.disliked: — The sofa bed wasn't the most comfortable

reviews.text: The proximity of the beaches was another plus, and Kihei has so much to offer we ran out of time before we could do all we wanted to. We came for the water sports and we weren't disappointed, having such a nice place to stay was the cherry on top.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Kamaole Sands. The first week we were with my family, so we stayed in a completely renovated 3 bedroom/3 bath, unit 9-405. My dad found this unit somehow, and booked it through the owner, not the resort. Great value for $299/night. It had air conditioning in the living room, master bedroom, and loft bedroom. The 2nd bedroom, which we were in had no AC and it did get a tad warm at night, as did our bathroom. That being said, however, it was a great place to stay with 7 of us. Much cheaper than renting a house, and 3 bedroom condos are a bit hard to come by in that area. Great location because of the beaches close by.
reviews.title: Luxurious

likes.disliked: — Not very good maid service and bad AC

reviews.text: The second week my husband and I stayed in a one bedroom/ one bath that also had been completely renovated, unit 7-209. This one we rented through VRBO, which I highly recommend. You get direct contact with the owners and can see pictures of the condo you are getting. This was a great condo overlooking the garden area, close to the pool. It had a very large lanai which we enjoyed nightly. It also had a new King size bed, with very comfortable linens, and the condo was equipped with anything you may need, including beach gear. Again, the location, as well as the value, of Kamaole Sands can't be beat. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would use it again if we go back.
reviews.title: Kamaole Sands in Maui was Perfect!

reviews.text: I actually won a free trip and stay in Maui at the Kamaole Sands Condominium Resort. The word "Condominium" really sounds like a downgrade. But with the huge property, gorgeous garden, high class pool, and spacious condo units, this place was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It had a kitchen, living room, bedroom, and two baths with a lanai overlooking a beautiful garden. One thing that did not work with me was there is no central air-conditioning. There was just a built in AC that had a four hour timer. So when you wake up in the morning, it gets stuffy since the air turns off. Also, the air does not reach the entire unit. The bedroom was extremely hot. The ceiling fan just did not do it. Other than that, this place is a great place to stay in Kihei.
reviews.title: Great Times in Kihei

description: Castle Kamaole Sands Maui Condos across from the beach in South Kihei. One and two bedroom remodeled units loaded with all the amenities. A/C, internet, fully equipped kitchens and more! Property has pool, two spas and tennis courts. Walk to shops, restaurants and activities. Affordable rates with summer and last minute specials.
